insight: ChatControl's Discord integration requires the DiscordSRV plugin. Users must disable DiscordSRV's built-in chat relay by setting `DiscordChatChannelMinecraftToDiscord: false` in DiscordSRV's `config.yml`, otherwise messages get duplicated. ChatControl checks this on startup and logs a warning if it's still enabled (see ChatControl.java line ~247).

VelocityControl's `Chat_Forwarding.Enabled` is ONLY for relaying raw chat to/from servers that do NOT have ChatControl installed. When both servers have ChatControl, cross-server chat works via the channel system (`Proxy: true` on the channel + `proxy.yml` Enabled on each backend) — Chat_Forwarding should be `false` in that case. Users frequently confuse these two mechanisms and toggle Chat_Forwarding thinking it's needed for normal cross-server channels.

Plugins spawning fake/NPC players can break proxy forwarding after some time — the proxy pipeline doesn't filter NPCs from online player lists. When a user reports proxy forwarding "works then stops", ask about NPC plugins and test without them. Also, server names allow hyphens (`[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+`), contrary to what the skill file states.
